entry.title: Worse than ever
entry.content:
I‚Äôm disappointed i can‚Äôt rate 0 stars for this, as it deserves no rating. The app is worse than ever and buggy, being so full of corporate greed i‚Äôm surprised you are able to see or understand anything beyond your selfish little world. Can‚Äôt watch anything without having to reset the internet, login 10 times and then disappointedly watch the audio and video out of sync, laggy and terrible quality.
Anyone who made the decision to release this app and push forward with it should be locked up and the key thrown away. Congratulations on ruining a countries sporting support, with one flick of a switch. I feel bad for anyone working on this project, and I apologise for you having to read this. But your ‚Äòhigher-ups‚Äô are terrible greedy selfish disgraces to this Nation. They deserve to be known and all the hate directed on them rather than the frantically working coders who have been thrown unceremoniously into this.
Have a terrible day
Yours truly,
New Zealand

entry.title: Reliable App

Logged out, deleted app and reloaded and no problems whatsoever since. Only real bugbear is no opportunity to download and watch offline, given I spend 3hrs a day commuting I really need this

Logged out, deleted app and reloaded and no problems whatsoever since. Only real bugbear is no opportunity to download and watch offline, given I spend 3hrs a day commuting I really need this

entry.title: Cheaper than sky, but for far less actual rugby
entry.content: Error after error every time I try watch using the mobile app. One time it‚Äôs telling me I‚Äôm not in New Zealand when I‚Äôm sitting at home in Auckland. The next it‚Äôs an invalid response received from manifest request Status code 403 3006. Has been a very poor customer experience where I‚Äôve seen more errors than games when trying to use the app. Not impressed as it‚Äôs operated like a beta while the full price is charged to customers. ‚ÄòTis the sad reality of the predatory nature of the market nowadays as they know customers will pay regardless.

entry.title: Overreaching
entry.content: This is the first review I‚Äôve ever given on anything. Why? Why did you decide to do this when it‚Äôs obvious you can‚Äôt? Yet again my planned RWC evening has already been ruined and I‚Äôm only a third of the way through. The app continually crashes, the picture quality is appalling and I even had the famous green and purple lines for the first time. And it‚Äôs not my set up because sometimes - maybe 25% - it all works fine with good quality picture. The app is a disgrace and whoever made the ‚Äúbold audacious‚Äù decision to go for it should hang their head in shame. Or has he left already?

entry.title: Speed is ok. But functionality does not work properly
entry.content:
Very poor functionality overall
Going through the menus is difficult on a Apple TV despite the fact that this app has been recently released
Many things do NOT work in the way that you would expect and on top of that there are errors
For example when you attempt to go into a LIVE match and select ‚Äúplay from the start‚Äù, this does not work and jumps you to the current time to watch it Live so instead of going to enjoy the full match in one case I jumped into it at 68 minutes and 44 seconds. Really poor that Something this obvious was not tested.
Spark, raise your game, and stop being so arrogant. You are no longer a monopoly. Luckily I don‚Äôt like cricket so I will be using this any RWC

entry.title: Useless
entry.content:
App performs poorly, looks good from a UI perspective but the back end is terrible.
Week before the biggest rugby event, letter arrives saying we can‚Äôt watch due to the internet at our place (provided by spark who own Spark sport). Now this is an issue but not sparks sports, so I made arrangements to view at a mates place who has 100/20. So I know that‚Äôs good. This is where the troubles start.
Picture quality is terrible, stutters and looses picture all the time, the 3 dots of death (buffering) and audio issues, and that‚Äôs just so far. This company were not prepared to put development into this app or the back end and have been blaming everyone or thing for the issues. The overseas streaming is done by Akamai, who appear to know what they are doing but the app constantly freezes and crashes. I‚Äôve turned the auto update on, deleted it and reinstalled it, then not used the app and used the website and got the same results.
I should have read the reviews that pointed out constant streaming issues with smaller events. I have no faith this will be fixed without the company ducking for cover, and anticipate a copy and paste reply or passive aggressive reply about this review. Check their Facebook page for more info about the app issues and streaming issues, but be aware, they are deleting people‚Äôs comments.
Poor effort spark sport, poor streaming and crashes has ruined the RWC for us all.

Useless

App performs poorly, looks good from a UI perspective but the back end is terrible.

Week before the biggest rugby event, letter arrives saying we can‚Äôt watch due to the internet at our place (provided by spark who own Spark sport). Now this is an issue but not sparks sports, so I made arrangements to view at a mates place who has 100/20. So I know that‚Äôs good. This is where the troubles start.

Picture quality is terrible, stutters and looses picture all the time, the 3 dots of death (buffering) and audio issues, and that‚Äôs just so far. This company were not prepared to put development into this app or the back end and have been blaming everyone or thing for the issues. The overseas streaming is done by Akamai, who appear to know what they are doing but the app constantly freezes and crashes. I‚Äôve turned the auto update on, deleted it and reinstalled it, then not used the app and used the website and got the same results.

I should have read the reviews that pointed out constant streaming issues with smaller events. I have no faith this will be fixed without the company ducking for cover, and anticipate a copy and paste reply or passive aggressive reply about this review. Check their Facebook page for more info about the app issues and streaming issues, but be aware, they are deleting people‚Äôs comments.

Poor effort spark sport, poor streaming and crashes has ruined the RWC for us all.

entry.title: Very limited app
entry.content:
Updated review I reviewed this several months ago during the beta release and a free trial, giving it 2 out of 5. Coming back to it recently not much has changed.
On the plus side: -Picture quality is good on my iPhone and laptop. There are occasional pauses for buffering but nothing serious with my 100mbs fibre connection. That is the plus points done with.
On the negative side: - There is no search function meaning it is difficult to find what you want quickly. - There is no way to identify the sports and events of interest to you meaning the home page is dominated with irrelevant content. - Sound consistently becomes out of sync with the picture. The longer the event the greater the difference. For example, at the end of a 2 hour Grand Prix this is a 5 to 10 second difference. Reloading the stream doesn‚Äôt fix it. - It is impossible to purchase access for individual sports events. You need to pay full price for everything even if you don‚Äôt want it. Interested in a particular grand prix or football match but don‚Äôt want to pay for the whole service? Tough. Pay for everything or get nothing. It is an outdated business model which doesn‚Äôt fit a streaming service.
I still cannot recommend this product. It needs significant improvements to deliver and consistent product and pricing model which welcomes those with a passing interest to watch instead of serving die hard fans.

Very limited app

Updated review
I reviewed this several months ago during the beta release and a free trial, giving it 2 out of 5. Coming back to it recently not much has changed.

On the plus side:
-Picture quality is good on my iPhone and laptop. There are occasional pauses for buffering but nothing serious with my 100mbs fibre connection. That is the plus points done with.

On the negative side:
- There is no search function meaning it is difficult to find what you want quickly.
- There is no way to identify the sports and events of interest to you meaning the home page is dominated with irrelevant content.
- Sound consistently becomes out of sync with the picture. The longer the event the greater the difference. For example, at the end of a 2 hour Grand Prix this is a 5 to 10 second difference. Reloading the stream doesn‚Äôt fix it.
- It is impossible to purchase access for individual sports events. You need to pay full price for everything even if you don‚Äôt want it. Interested in a particular grand prix or football match but don‚Äôt want to pay for the whole service? Tough. Pay for everything or get nothing. It is an outdated business model which doesn‚Äôt fit a streaming service.

I still cannot recommend this product. It needs significant improvements to deliver and consistent product and pricing model which welcomes those with a passing interest to watch instead of serving die hard fans.

entry.title: Not a Good Experience
entry.content:
Subscribed for RWC. Watching games on-demand at off-peak times, many times during a game the picture pixelates and freezes. Also the picture is continuously switching in and out of HD all though a game. Overall not a great experience.
Watching via ultrafast fibre, iPad Pro > Chromecast > 2018 LG OLED TV.
Spark Sport promised there would be an app for this TV so we paid for the app in good faith - then they reneged on their promise. Unimpressed.
Edit: Just watched our first live game - JPN v IRE. More pixelation, freezing, buffering. Very frustrating. About half the game was at less than HD resolution. Simply not good enough. Have changed rating from 2- to 1-star.

Not a Good Experience

Subscribed for RWC. Watching games on-demand at off-peak times, many times during a game the picture pixelates and freezes. Also the picture is continuously switching in and out of HD all though a game. Overall not a great experience.

Watching via ultrafast fibre, iPad Pro > Chromecast > 2018 LG OLED TV.

Spark Sport promised there would be an app for this TV so we paid for the app in good faith - then they reneged on their promise. Unimpressed.

Edit: Just watched our first live game - JPN v IRE. More pixelation, freezing, buffering. Very frustrating. About half the game was at less than HD resolution. Simply not good enough. Have changed rating from 2- to 1-star.

Works well most of the time

No problems with functionality in a variety of situations including hotel wifi with a VPN for security. Some buffering during SA game but picture quality outstanding.

entry.title: Very poor option - find something else
entry.content: Update: extremely poor handling. You should never have taken on this service if you could not handle it. I‚Äôm happy it‚Äôs working for some people, but the buffering and freezing makes live sport unwatchable for others, including me. We were able to watch the first three games with just some quality issues, but the ABs game was terrible - gave up. Want a full refund.

entry.title: Disappointed
entry.content: Watching the game live it was very blurry at times not the greatest app was better watching when sky had the World Cup pretty disappointed

Disappointed

Watching the game live it was very blurry at times not the greatest app was better watching when sky had the World Cup pretty disappointed
